android-tutorials.text: The following applications give a step-by-step tutorial for Android applications. Each respective application can be run by cd-ing to the base directory and invoking "ant run-Android".

application.name: HelloWorld (prog)
application.text: Simple HelloWorld application for Android. Implementation without any layout resources.

application.name: HelloWorld (decl)
application.text: Simple HelloWorld application for Android. Implementation using a simple layout resource to declare the content view.

application.name: Layout (linear)
application.text: A simple Android application demonstrating layout capabilities using a LinearLayout.

application.name: Layout (relative)
application.text: A simple Android application demonstrating layout capabilities using a RelativeLayout.

application.name: SayHello (prog)
application.text: A simple Android application demonstrating simple event handling with a button as well as accessing UI widgets. The application is implemented without declaring layout resources.

application.name: SayHello (decl)
application.text: A simple Android application demonstrating simple event handling with a button as well as accessing UI widgets. The application is implemented declaring a layout resources which also declares the Button's event handler.

application.name: Widgets
application.text: Application to demonstrate the User Interface widgets in Android.

application.name: Activities (explicit)
application.text: A simple Android application demonstrating the explicit switching between activities with the called activity providing a result to the calling activity. Additionally the application facilitates a BackKey handler.

application.name: Activities (implicit)
application.text: Two Android applications demonstrating the implicit launching of activities. There are three activities that respond to the same action (Yellow, Red, and Green) prompting Android to show an activity chooser.

application.name: Fragments
application.text: Two fragments that are shown side-by-side in landscape mode and in two separate activities in portrait mode.

application.name: List
application.text: Use a RecyclerView to display a list of items where each item is rendered in a CardView. Also shows usage of an Floating Action Button.

application.name: Navigation Drawer
application.text: Application to demonstrate the usage of the Navigation Drawer.

application.name: TabLayout
application.text: Application to demonstrate the usage of the TabLayout from the Design Support Library.

application.name: Alerts
application.text: Shows the use of toasts, snackbars and alert dialogs.

application.name: MultiTouch
application.text: A simple multi-touch example. Fingers placed on the screen are tracked while being moved.

application.name: Drawing
application.text: A simple Android application demonstrating drawing capabilities using the Canvas and Paint classes.

application.name: Handler
application.text: Shows the use of a Handler to post messages to the UI thread.

application.name: AsyncTask
application.text: Shows usage of AsyncTask to simplify background processing.

application.name: Notification
application.text: Shows usage of normal view notification.

application.name: Service (started)
application.text: Demonstrates the use of a started service.

application.name: Service (bound)
application.text: Demonstrates the use of a bound service.

application.name: Settings
application.text: Using settings under Android.

application.name: Map
application.text: A simple Android application demonstrating using MapActivity from the Google Android API.

application.name: Accelerometer
application.text: A simple Android application demonstrating how to get the accelerometer sensor readings.

application.name: Gyroscope
application.text: Simple Android aplication to demonstrate use of Gyroscope sensor in Android.

application.name: GPS
application.text: A simple Android application displaying the current longitude and latitude.

application.name: Camera
application.text: Simple Android aplication to demonstrate use of camera in Android.

application.name: NFC Reader
application.text: Read NDEF-formatted NFC tags.

application.name: Sound
application.text: Simple Android aplication to demonstrate use of MediaPlayer for audio playback.

application.name: Animation
application.text: Uses property animation to bounce a ball across the screen.

application.name: Storage
application.text: Show various ways of making data persistent.

application.name: Immersive
application.text: Demonstrates immersive mode where an application can take over the whole screen.

application.name: Internationalization
application.text: Simple HelloWorld application for Android. Implementation using a simple layout resource to declare the content view being showed. Application name and the greeting text are defined by String resources to support internationalization.

application.name: Espresso UI Test
application.text: UI testing tutorial for SayHello declarative version using Espresso.

application.name: BroadcastReceiver
application.text: An application to demonstrate BroadcastReceiver in Android.
